required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Of Sunitinib With S-1 And Cisplatin For Gastric Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study Of Sunitinib In Combination With S-1 And Cisplatin In Patients With Advanced Or Metastatic Gastric Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the maximal tolerated dose (MTD) and overall safety of sunitinib when administered in combination with S-1 and Cisplatin in patients with advanced/metastatic gastric cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With First Cycle Dose-limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
primary_outcome.description: A DLT is any of a predefined set of unacceptable adverse events, regardless of cause. DLTs were assessed during the first cycle (4 weeks).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Sunitinib, SU-012662, and Total Drug (Sunitinib + SU-012662)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 and 2 (pre-dose, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 24 hours post-dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Sunitinib, SU-012662, and Total Drug (Sunitinib + SU-012662)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 and 2 (pre-dose, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 24 hours post-dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) of Sunitinib, SU-012662, and Total Drug (Sunitinib + SU-012662)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 and 2 (pre-dose, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 24 hours post-dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast)

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Tegafur and 5-FU
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 and 2 (pre-dose, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10 hours post-dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Tegafur and 5-FU
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 and 2 (pre-dose, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10 hours post-dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) of Tegafur and 5-FU
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 and 2 (pre-dose, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10 hours post-dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast)

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Total Platinum and Free Platinum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 and 2 (pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 8, and 22 hours after completing infusion)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Total Platinum and Free Platinum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 and 2 (pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 8, and 22 hours after completing infusion)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) of Total Platinum and Free Platinum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 and 2 (pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 8, and 22 hours after completing infusion)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Objective Response
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with objective response-based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). CR defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. PR defined as greater than or equal to (â‰¥) 30 percent (%) decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinical Benefit Response (CBR)
secondary_outcome.description: CBR is defined as a confirmed complete response (CR), confirmed partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD) for at least 24 weeks on study according to RECIST. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.

Time from the first objective documentation of tumor response (confirmed or partial response) to first documented objective tumor progression or death due to cancer. DR calculated as (the end date for DR minus first subsequent confirmed CR or PR plus 1 day).

Median time from the enrollment to the first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. PFS calculated as (first event date minus enrollment date plus 1 day)

Time in months from enrollment to first documentation of objective tumor progression. TTP was calculated as (first event date or last known progression-free date minus the date of enrollment plus 1 day). Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data meet the criteria for progressive disease [PD] per RECIST).

intervention.description: Cisplatin 60 mg/m2 on day 1 of each 28 day cycle
S-1 80 mg/m2 on days 1-21 of each 28 day cycle
Sunitinib 25 mg, 37.5 mg and 50 mg daily S-1 80 mg/m2 on days 1-21 of each 28 day cycle Cisplatin 60 mg/m2 on day 1 of each 28 day cycle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of gastric cancer
- Chemonaive patients
- Adequate organ function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who meet the contra-indications of S-1 and Cisplatin.
- Prior chemotherapy failure patients

facility.name: Aichi cancer center central hospital / Medical Oncology

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Three to 6 participants at each dose regimen were to be initially assessed for dose limiting toxicity (dose escalation cohort) and 10 participants were added to the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) group after MTD was determined at Sunitinib 25 mg once daily for 2 weeks followed by 2 weeks off-treatment (Schedule 2/2) regimen (MTD expansion cohort).

group.title: Sunitinib 25 mg CDD + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 25 mg orally once daily continuously (CDD), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle.

group.title: Sunitinib 25 mg 2/2 + S-1 + Cisplatin (All)
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 25 mg orally once daily for 2 weeks followed by 2 weeks off-treatment (Schedule 2/2), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 (dose escalation cohort) or Day 2 (dose expansion cohort) of each 4 week cycle. Dose expansion cohort was added after the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) was determined from the dose limiting toxicity (DLT) evaluation.

group.title: Sunitinib 37.5 mg 2/2 + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 37.5 mg orally once daily for 2 weeks followed by 2 weeks off-treatment (Schedule 2/2), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle.

group.title: Sunitinib 12.5 mg CDD + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 12.5 mg orally once daily continuously (CDD), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off -treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle. One participant who was assigned to the sunitinib 25 mg on CDD treatment group inadvertently took sunitinib 12.5 mg/day throughout the study, therefore this participant was analyzed separately in this group.

group.title: Sunitinib 25 mg CDD + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 25 mg orally once daily continuously (CDD), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle.

group.title: Sunitinib 25 mg 2/2 + S-1 + Cisplatin (All)
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 25 mg orally once daily for 2 weeks followed by 2 weeks off-treatment (Schedule 2/2), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 (dose escalation cohort) or Day 2 (dose expansion cohort) of each 4 week cycle. Dose expansion cohort was added after the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) was determined from the dose limiting toxicity (DLT) evaluation.

group.title: Sunitinib 37.5 mg 2/2 + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 37.5 mg orally once daily for 2 weeks followed by 2 weeks off-treatment (Schedule 2/2), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle.

group.title: Sunitinib 12.5 mg CDD + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 12.5 mg orally once daily continuously (CDD), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off -treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle. One participant who was assigned to the sunitinib 25 mg on CDD treatment group inadvertently took sunitinib 12.5 mg/day throughout the study, therefore this participant was analyzed separately in this group.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Participants With First Cycle Dose-limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
outcome.description: A DLT is any of a predefined set of unacceptable adverse events, regardless of cause. DLTs were assessed during the first cycle (4 weeks).
outcome.population: DLT Evaluation Set consisted of participants who were initially enrolled for the determination of maximam tolerated dose (MTD), and either 'experienced DLT' or 'received all of the Day 1 chemotherapy, received at least 80% of their sunitinib doses, and at least 80% of S-1 doses'.

group.title: Sunitinib 25 mg CDD + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 25 mg orally once daily continuously (CDD), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle.

group.title: Sunitinib 25 mg 2/2 + S-1 + Cisplatin (Dose Escalation Cohort)
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 25 mg orally once daily for 2 weeks followed by 2 weeks off-treatment (Schedule 2/2), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily regimen for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle.

group.title: Sunitinib 37.5 mg 2/2 + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 37.5 mg orally once daily for 2 weeks followed by 2 weeks off-treatment (Schedule 2/2), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle.

measure.title: Number of Participants With First Cycle Dose-limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
measure.description: A DLT is any of a predefined set of unacceptable adverse events, regardless of cause. DLTs were assessed during the first cycle (4 weeks).
measure.population: DLT Evaluation Set consisted of participants who were initially enrolled for the determination of maximam tolerated dose (MTD), and either 'experienced DLT' or 'received all of the Day 1 chemotherapy, received at least 80% of their sunitinib doses, and at least 80% of S-1 doses'.

outcome.title: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Sunitinib, SU-012662, and Total Drug (Sunitinib + SU-012662)
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 and 2 (pre-dose, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 24 hours post-dose)
outcome.population: Participants who received Sunitinib and had sufficient plasma concentration data for calculation of pharmacokinetic parameters

group.title: Sunitinib 25 mg 2/2 + Cisplatin + S-1 (MTD Expansion Cohort)
group.description: Subset of Sunitinib 25 mg 2/2 + Cisplatin + S-1 arm consisted of participants who were additionally enrolled after the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of sunitinib was determined as 25 mg orally once daily for 2 weeks followed by 2 weeks off-treatment

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Objective Response
outcome.description: Number of participants with objective response-based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). CR defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. PR defined as greater than or equal to (â‰¥) 30 percent (%) decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set consisted of all participants enrolled in the study who received at least 1 dose of study medication (cisplatin, S-1 or sunitinib)

group.title: Sunitinib 25 mg CDD + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 25 mg orally once daily continuously (CDD), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle.

One participant who was assigned to the sunitinib 25 mg on CDD treatment group inadvertently took sunitinib 12.5 mg/day throughout the study, therefore this participant was analyzed separately in this group.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Objective Response
measure.description: Number of participants with objective response-based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). CR defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. PR defined as greater than or equal to (â‰¥) 30 percent (%) decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set consisted of all participants enrolled in the study who received at least 1 dose of study medication (cisplatin, S-1 or sunitinib)

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Clinical Benefit Response (CBR)
outcome.description: CBR is defined as a confirmed complete response (CR), confirmed partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD) for at least 24 weeks on study according to RECIST. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set consisted of all participants enrolled in the study who received at least 1 dose of study medication (cisplatin, S-1 or sunitinib).

One participant who was assigned to the sunitinib 25 mg on CDD treatment group inadvertently took sunitinib 12.5 mg/day throughout the study, therefore this participant was analyzed separately in this group.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Clinical Benefit Response (CBR)
measure.description: CBR is defined as a confirmed complete response (CR), confirmed partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD) for at least 24 weeks on study according to RECIST. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set consisted of all participants enrolled in the study who received at least 1 dose of study medication (cisplatin, S-1 or sunitinib).

outcome.title: Duration of Response (DR)
outcome.description: Time from the first objective documentation of tumor response (confirmed or partial response) to first documented objective tumor progression or death due to cancer. DR calculated as (the end date for DR minus first subsequent confirmed CR or PR plus 1 day).
outcome.population: A subgroup of participants with an objective tumor response among Full Analysis Set consisted of all participants enrolled in the study who received at least 1 dose of study medication (cisplatin, S-1 or sunitinib)

group.title: Sunitinib 25 mg CDD + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 25 mg orally once daily continuously (CDD), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle.

group.title: Sunitinib 25 mg 2/2 + S-1 + Cisplatin (All)
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 25 mg orally once daily for 2 weeks followed by 2 weeks off-treatment (Schedule 2/2), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 (dose escalation cohort) or Day 2 (dose expansion cohort) of each 4 week cycle. Dose expansion cohort was added after the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) was determined from the dose limiting toxicity (DLT) evaluation.

group.title: Sunitinib 37.5 mg 2/2 + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 37.5 mg orally once daily for 2 weeks followed by 2 weeks off-treatment (Schedule 2/2), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle.

group.title: Sunitinib 12.5 mg CDD + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 12.5 mg orally once daily continuously (CDD), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off -treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle. One participant who was assigned to the sunitinib 25 mg on CDD treatment group inadvertently took sunitinib 12.5 mg/day throughout the study, therefore this participant was analyzed separately in this group.

measure.title: Duration of Response (DR)
measure.description: Time from the first objective documentation of tumor response (confirmed or partial response) to first documented objective tumor progression or death due to cancer. DR calculated as (the end date for DR minus first subsequent confirmed CR or PR plus 1 day).
measure.population: A subgroup of participants with an objective tumor response among Full Analysis Set consisted of all participants enrolled in the study who received at least 1 dose of study medication (cisplatin, S-1 or sunitinib)

measurement_list.measurement: There were too few events (objective tumor progression or death) to estimate the upper limit of confidence interval

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: Median time from the enrollment to the first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. PFS calculated as (first event date minus enrollment date plus 1 day)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set consisted of all participants enrolled in the study who received at least 1 dose of study medication (cisplatin, S-1 or sunitinib).

group.title: Sunitinib 25 mg CDD + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 25 mg orally once daily continuously (CDD), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle.

group.title: Sunitinib 25 mg 2/2 + S-1 + Cisplatin (All)
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 25 mg orally once daily for 2 weeks followed by 2 weeks off-treatment (Schedule 2/2), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 (dose escalation cohort) or Day 2 (dose expansion cohort) of each 4 week cycle. Dose expansion cohort was added after the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) was determined from the dose limiting toxicity (DLT) evaluation.

group.title: Sunitinib 37.5 mg 2/2 + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 37.5 mg orally once daily for 2 weeks followed by 2 weeks off-treatment (Schedule 2/2), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off-treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle.

group.title: Sunitinib 12.5 mg CDD + S-1 + Cisplatin
group.description: Study drugs were administered at following regimens in repeating 4 week cycles; Sunitinib at dose of 12.5 mg orally once daily continuously (CDD), S-1 at the starting dose of 80-120 mg/day based on body surface area as a twice daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off -treatment, cisplatin was administered once at 60 mg/m^2 on Day 1 of each 4 week cycle. One participant who was assigned to the sunitinib 25 mg on CDD treatment group inadvertently took sunitinib 12.5 mg/day throughout the study, therefore this participant was analyzed separately in this group.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: Median time from the enrollment to the first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. PFS calculated as (first event date minus enrollment date plus 1 day)
measure.population: Full Analysis Set consisted of all participants enrolled in the study who received at least 1 dose of study medication (cisplatin, S-1 or sunitinib).

outcome.title: Time to Progression (TTP)
outcome.description: Time in months from enrollment to first documentation of objective tumor progression. TTP was calculated as (first event date or last known progression-free date minus the date of enrollment plus 1 day). Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data meet the criteria for progressive disease [PD] per RECIST).
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set consisted of all participants enrolled in the study who received at least 1 dose of study medication (cisplatin, S-1 or sunitinib).

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
